intro: Elatostema costatoalatum, commonly known as the wavy-leaf elatostema, is a species of flowering plant in the family Elatostemaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia, particularly found in countries like India, China, and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, wavy-edged leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming during the summer months. Elatostema costatoalatum is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and ease of cultivation.
